channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023090459
item.description:
Report E-2023090459

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced a UN1263 Carbocoat 8239 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to an 8’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents utilized to clean the impacted area were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081545
item.description:
Report X-2023081545

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: FORT SMITH
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to qa for not being processed by origin station in the hazmat app. Upon inspection of box notice the package was leaking from the bottom corner of box. It was then placed inside hazmat tote. DescribePack: The top cap of metal can was loose and looks like the package may have been place on its side in transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The cap to tightened.

item.title: Report E-2023090325
item.description:
Report E-2023090325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: BENTON
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the van trailer, technicians discovered that a drum of methyl methacrylate had polymerized. Some material vented from the drum and solidified as expanded foam on top of the drum and on the side of the drum. The solidified material and polymerized drum were repackaged.

item.title: Report X-2023081404
item.description:
Report X-2023081404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO HAZMAT LEAKER ON THE TWILIGHT SORT. LEAKING PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR SET ON SIDE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET FOR PROPER PPE AND CLEAN UP. PACKAGE AND ALL CONTENTS PLACED IN DMN TRAY TO BE TAKEN TO DMN AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
